ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: The event name for which the data was collected
Gestation weeks at birth of baby
Gestation days [in addition to weeks] at birth of baby (Coding 0 - 6)
Baby's weight at birth
Baby's length at birth
Baby's head circumference at birth
Order in which this baby was delivered
Total number of babies delivered
Primary clinical reason for episode of care
Notes: 10 = Preterm; 11 = Respiratory disease; 12 = Cardiovascular disease; 13 = Failed oximetry screening; 14 = infection; 15 = Jaundice; 16 = Poor feeding; 17 = Weight loss; 18 = Hypoglycaemia; 19 = Convulsions; 20 = Asphyxia; 21 = Other neurological disease; 22 = Congenital abnormality; 23 = Social issues/foster care; 24 = Surgery; 25 = Cardiac disease; 26 = Investigation; 27 = Monitoring; 28 = Poor condition at birth; 30 = HIE Suspected/Confirmed; 31 = IUGR/SGA; 35 = GIT disease; 38 = Contuning care; 39 = Readmission; 88 = Other; 99 = Unknown

ElementDescription: Age at Discharge
Baby's weight at discharge
Baby's head circumference at discharge
Milk being given to baby at the time of discharge or transfer (0, None)
Milk being given to baby at the time of discharge or transfer (1, Breast)
Milk being given to baby at the time of discharge or transfer (2, Full term formula)
Milk being given to baby at the time of discharge or transfer (3, Preterm formula)
Milk being given to baby at the time of discharge or transfer (4, Other)
Milk being given to baby at the time of discharge or transfer (9, Unknown)
Is any of the feed being given via a nasogastric, orogastric or gastrostomy tube, at the time of discharge home?
Records if baby requires intermittent or continuous supplementation with oxygen on the day of discharge and to be continued following discharge
Total number of days in this episode when baby received ventilatory support through an endotracheal tube. Ventilation for part of a day counts as a whole day in this total
Total number of days when baby received CPAP alone. If ventilation on the same day then this is not counted as a CPAP day
Total number of days when baby recorded as receiving any oxygen by any means
Mother's Occupation
Age in completed years of mother at time of delivery
Ethnicity of mother
ValueRange: A ; B ; C ; D ; E ; F ; G ; H ; J ; K ; L ; M ; N ; P ; R ; S ; Z ; DTA
Notes: A = White: British; B = White: Irish; C = White: Other; D = Mixed: White & Black Caribbean; E = Mixed: White & Black African; F = Mixed: White & Asian; G = Mixed: Other; H = Asian: Indian; J = Asian: Pakistani; K = Asian: Bangladeshi; L = Asian: Other; M = Black: Caribbean; N = Black: African; P = Black: Other; R = Other: Chinese; S = Other: Any Other; Z = Not stated; DTA = Declined to Answer

ElementDescription: The gestational age, in completed weeks, of this baby calculated from agreed EDD and date of birth
The number of days (0 to 6) between completed weeks of gestation, calculated from EDD and date of birth
Administration of any dose of steroid to mother (dexamethasone or betamethasone), at any time during pregnancy, with the intention of maturing fetal lungs
Mode of delivery
Notes: 1 = Emergency caesarean section - not in labour; 2 = Emergency caesarean section - in labour; 3 = Elective section - not in labour; 4 = Elective section - in labour; 5 = Vaginal - forceps assisted; 6 = Vaginal- spontaneous; 7 = Vaginal - ventouse assisted; 9 = Unknown

Was surfactant was given during resuscitation?
Records that on any day during this episode of care the baby was diagnosed as having seizures - either clinical or on EEG/CFAM.
Maximum grade (Sarnat & Sarnat) of hypoxic ischaemic encephalopathy (HIE) recorded at any time during this episode of care
List of anticonvulsant drugs given during this episode (comma delimited list) - includes phenobarbitone, penytoin, clonazepam, paraldehyde
Pneumothorax recorded as being present on any day in this episode
Necrotising enterocolitis was suspected or confirmed on any day in this episode.
Neonatal abstinence syndrome was diagnosed on any day in this episode

Ibuprofen used at any time during this episode to close PDA

Total number of days where recorded that baby was receiving parenteral nutrition during this episode
List of all congenital anamolies noted

Whether baby was given Nitric Oxide or Sildenafil
List of inotropes in this episode. Includes dopamine, dobutamine, adrenaline and noradrenaline.

Records if a silo for management of gastroschisis was in situ at point in this episode
This records if the baby was cooled as part of management of suspected hypoxic ischaemic damage to the brain. Includes both passive and active cooling
Age of the fetus (i.e., gestational age) in days
Type of gestational age used for fetal_age
Notes: 1 = Postovulatory gestational age, defined as days since the last ovulation, expected term of 266 days; 2 = Postmenstrual gestational age, days since the last menstrual period, expected term of 280 days
